title: Ticket #176: Consistent new-lines in the source repository
description:
Seems like this may solve our Windows/*nix new-line problem:

http://github.com/guides/dealing-with-newlines-in-git

Only everyone must participate. I hate opening Windows source random *nix new-lines and I quite positive you all hate the reverse. The above page seems to offer a pretty good fix to the whole thing, without requiring much thought on anyone's part.

As an alternative, it would be great to simply have all the source code have *inx new-lines. This way Emacs wouldn't have random ^M characters everywhere and Visual Studio would not ask me each time if I'd like to normalize a file to Windows or *inx new-lines.
